propertyDescriptor.name: auto.offset.reset
propertyDescriptor.description: Allows you to manage the condition when there is no initial offset in Kafka or if the current offset does not exist any more on the server (e.g. because that data has been deleted). Corresponds to Kafka's 'auto.offset.reset' property.

allowableValues.description: Automatically reset the offset to the earliest offset
Automatically reset the offset to the latest offset
Throw exception to the consumer if no previous offset is found for the consumer's group

propertyDescriptor.name: bootstrap.servers
propertyDescriptor.description: A comma-separated list of known Kafka Brokers in the format <host>:<port>

propertyDescriptor.name: group.id
propertyDescriptor.description: A Group ID is used to identify consumers that are within the same consumer group. Corresponds to Kafka's 'group.id' property.

propertyDescriptor.name: key-attribute-encoding
propertyDescriptor.description: FlowFiles that are emitted have an attribute named 'kafka.key'. This property dictates how the value of the attribute should be encoded.

allowableValues.description: The key is interpreted as a UTF-8 Encoded string.
The key is interpreted as arbitrary binary data and is encoded using hexadecimal characters with uppercase letters

propertyDescriptor.name: sasl.kerberos.service.name
propertyDescriptor.description: The Kerberos principal name that Kafka runs as. This can be defined either in Kafka's JAAS config or in Kafka's config. Corresponds to Kafka's 'security.protocol' property.It is ignored unless one of the SASL options of the <Security Protocol> are selected.

propertyDescriptor.name: security.protocol
propertyDescriptor.description: Protocol used to communicate with brokers. Corresponds to Kafka's 'security.protocol' property.

propertyDescriptor.name: ssl.context.service
propertyDescriptor.description: Specifies the SSL Context Service to use for communicating with Kafka.

propertyDescriptor.name: topic
propertyDescriptor.description: The name of the Kafka Topic(s) to pull from. More than one can be supplied if comma separated.

propertyDescriptor.name: Feed Cleanup Event Service
propertyDescriptor.description: Service that manages the cleanup of feeds.

propertyDescriptor.name: Metadata Provider Service
propertyDescriptor.description: Service supplying the implementations of the various metadata providers.

propertyDescriptor.name: System feed category
propertyDescriptor.description: The category name of this feed. The default is to have this name automatically set when the feed is created. Normally you do not need to change the default value.

propertyDescriptor.name: System feed name
propertyDescriptor.description: The system name of this feed. The default is to have this name automatically set when the feed is created. Normally you do not need to change the default value.

propertyDescriptor.name: Stateful Variables Initial Value
propertyDescriptor.description: If using state to set/reference variables then this value is used to set the initial value of the stateful variable. This will only be used in the @OnScheduled method when state does not contain a value for the variable. This is required if running statefully but can be empty if needed.

properties.nameKey: NiFi Flow-Initialize Feed Parameters-Stateful Variables Initial Value
properties.processorNameTypeKey: Initialize Feed Parameters-false-Stateful Variables Initial Value

propertyDescriptor.name: Store State
propertyDescriptor.description: Select whether or not state will be stored. Selecting 'Stateless' will offer the default functionality of purely updating the attributes on a FlowFile in a stateless manner. Selecting a stateful option will not only store the attributes on the FlowFile but also in the Processors state. See the 'Stateful Usage' topic of the 'Additional Details' section of this processor's documentation for more information
